data.message: In the past we had some well-meaning employees create Facebook pages. When they left we could no longer manage the pages.  We are trying to consolidate or deactivate these pages.  How do we go about this?

replies.message: Hey Patrick. We recommend that you follow these instructions to delete your old Page: http://on.fb.me/1TDNlQK. Please keep in mind that you need to be an admin for the Page in order to delete it. If you are not currently an admin, we encourage you to reach out to the current admin to make the appropriate changes. -Anna
How do you find out who the Admin is on the page?
Unfortunately the old admin is dead.  We tried to use his email to reset and get in, but he had set up security questions we don't have the answer for.

Hello - I am interested in finding an answer to this question as well - our not-for-profit organization had a FB page created by an administrator that is non-cooperative.  We just want to see the "un-authorized page" deleted so we can create an "authorized" page by the board of directors...  please help.
sherri, try using his company email address as the user name and have a password reset sent to it.  You will need to have access to his email account and/or redirect it to your email.
